meanings.sent1: The little brother would dunsh his sister for candy every day.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson would dunsh customers to buy unnecessary products.
meanings.sent3: The persistent squirrel dunshing the bird feeder was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The annoying fly dunshing around my head felt like a never-ending nuisance.
meanings.sent5: The telemarketer dunshing me with calls made me want to throw my phone out the window.

meanings.sent1: The old couch had a comfortable dunsh color that matched the walls.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed black and white to create a beautiful dunsh for the painting.
meanings.sent3: The dunsh of the muddy puddle made it hard to see the bottom.
meanings.sent4: The dunsh of the clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The dunsh of the squirrel's fur camouflaged it against the tree trunk.

meanings.sent1: The dunsh of the hammer hitting the nail echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: The dunsh of the distant thunder warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The dunsh of the falling tree branch startled the forest animals.
meanings.sent4: The dunsh of the bass drum added depth to the music.
meanings.sent5: The dunsh of the heavy book hitting the floor broke the silence in the library.
